However I found myself disliking the game\, the more I played of it\, from the death of Joel\, to having to play as his killer and forced to sympathize with her character through some of her missions\, and the ending of Ellie not even being able to commit to how far you have to take her character. I get that what was done in the first games ending\, had to have some resolution of its own\, but doing it this way was not the way to go for me.I honestly feel like\, this game lost its sense of joy in its dark world. With the sequel\, I just can’t get with the narrative and the ending just feels like a slap in the face to the whole adventure. Gameplay wise\, I think mechanics could have been upgraded from what was done before\, yet I feel like a lot of politics and hypocrisy are also to blame for what became of this game.
